title: Compounding explode (!!)
description: Shadowrun-style exploding dice where all explosion rolls add to the same die total rather than being conceptually separate dice.

title: Success counting (e.g., 5d10>=8)

title: Penetrating explode (!p)
description: Exploding dice variant where each explosion subtracts 1 from the new roll.
design:
**Notation (Roll20-style):**
- `!p` - penetrating explode on max
- `!p>N` - penetrating explode on > N
- `!p<N` - penetrating explode on < N

**AST change:** Add `penetrating: bool` to `Modifier::Explode`, remove `once: bool`:
```rust
Explode {
    penetrating: bool,
    condition: Option<Condition>,
}
```

**Lexer:** Add `Token::P` for 'p' character.

**Parser:** After consuming `!`, check for `p` before parsing condition.

**Roller:** When `penetrating: true`, subtract 1 from each explosion roll's added value (not from the explosion check).

**Note:** `!o` (explode once) dropped - no real game system uses it. Compounding (`!!`) tracked separately in DM-21m.
acceptance_criteria:
- Penetrating explode notation: `!p` (e.g., `1d6!p`)
- Explosion triggers on raw roll hitting max value (same as regular explode)
- Each explosion roll has 1 subtracted from the value added to total
- Explosions can chain indefinitely (not limited to one extra roll)
- The -1 does NOT affect the explosion check, only the added value

Example: d6!p rolls 6 → 6 → 4
- First 6: add 6, explode (hit max)
- Second 6: add 5 (6-1), explode (raw roll hit max)
- Roll 4: add 3 (4-1), stop (raw roll didn't hit max)
- Total: 14
